docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Plain code block
docs.text:
def foo():
    bar = \
        'str'

    if not bar:
        return True

docs.title: Highlighting lines
docs.text:
def bubble_sort(items):
    for i in range(len(items)):
        for j in range(len(items) - 1 - i):
            if items[j] > items[j + 1]:
                items[j], items[j + 1] = items[j + 1], items[j]

docs.title: Equations
docs.text:
NOTE: I added a script for MathJax 

**_NOTE:_** I added a script for *MathJax*
[comment]: < script tag > (This is a comment, it will not be included) This is an inline equation: \(\(V_{sphere} = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\)\), followed by a display style equation:

\[V_{sphere} = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\]

docs.text:
:::

::: wiki-content ::: {.confluence-information-macro .confluence-information-macro-note} []{.aui-icon .aui-icon-small .aui-iconfont-warning .confluence-information-macro-icon}

::: confluence-information-macro-body Warning - The narratives below are just samples for testing. No text has been signed off. ::: :::

[]{#Bookmark2}

docs.title: Process Description
docs.text:
As stated previously, since we can't find a comprehensive graph theory in the current literature, we need to explore the sources available in the field to find the requirements of what a comprehensive graph theory would look like (conservative stage), in order to implement those requirements in the next stage (revisionary stage) as a base of our bG+ infrastructure (See Fig.1).

::: {.panel style="border-width: 1px;"} ::: {.panelHeader style="border-bottom-width: 1px;"} Process Diagrams - BG plus (Alternate) :::

::: panelContent [{.confluence-embedded-image .image-center width="624" height="327"}]{.confluence-embedded-file-wrapper .image-center-wrapper .confluence-embedded-manual-size}

Fig. 1 - bGPlus major stages ::: :::

[]{#Bookmark3}

docs.text:
• bGPlus - Process Description - Revisionary Stage{linked-resource-id="5951062017" linked-resource-version="1" linked-resource-type="page"}
  • bGPlus - Process Description - Conservative Stage{linked-resource-id="5950930948" linked-resource-version="2" linked-resource-type="page"}
  • bGPlus - Test Picture Storage{linked-resource-id="5950963721" linked-resource-version="1" linked-resource-type="page"} ::: ::: ::: :::

docs.title: Conservative Stage
docs.text:
The bG+ conservative stage aims to define the requirements of what a comprehensive graph theory would look like, and we could use the field terminology as a proxy for doing that.

Using the current field terminology we can

  • find out the requirements for a comprehensive theory

  • define our scope of work

  • build a preferred terminology, getting rid of any ambiguities

The process for it is described in Fig. 2.

[{.confluence-embedded-image .image-center width="624" height="336"}]{.confluence-embedded-file-wrapper .image-center-wrapper .confluence-embedded-manual-size}[]{#Bookmark6}
